turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/> Hello, hi, I'm Doctor Jacob and welcome to Babylon.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Hi. <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Hi. So, just before we start is it alright if you could confirm your name for me please?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yep, uh, John Doe.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK and your date of birth? <UNIN/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uhh, <UNIN/>  twenty-one twelve and nineteen uh eighty-six.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And, your address for me, please?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Is, uh, number one London Street. Um, NW three six PQ.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: That's correct.  And just to confirm that you're in a secure location and we can have a confidential conversation?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: We are, yes.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. So I understand you're having a <UNIN/> a headache is that correct?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh yeah, iIve had a, um a sort of a, a, a very sort of bad, severe headache, the past four days. Um, and um I've been sort of feeling a bit hot as well. Um, I've got, got a bit of a temperature, I think.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I haven't measured it but um, think I've, yeah, I think I've got a fever.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Right. And um, so what started first, was it the headache or the fever?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, so um, headache started uh, first. Um, and then sort of yeah, fever sort of came along a bit afterwards.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, afterwards, right. And what have you taken so far for your headache?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, so I've had some Paracetamol and some Ibuprofen, but it's not really helping at the moment.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/> OK. so just a few more questions, with regards to your headache  So do you find it difficult to look at the light?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yep.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um no, <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> like um it, it's fine, light doesn't seem to bother me too much.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Uh, and is it any pain when you try to move your neck from side to side, look up and down, is there any pain?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: And I've got some general aching muscles. Um, not necessarily sort of in my neck. It's kind of a bit all over, really.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, all over. Right, and have you been sick with this <UNIN/> headache?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No, no I haven't, I haven't been sick.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, and do you have a cough?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh no, no cough.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, so there's no cough or cold, yeah?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, no. No.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, and you your ears are OK? There's no earaches?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, no it's, it seems to be OK. It, it's fine.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, all right. And with this headache have you experienced any pins and needles in your face, arms and legs?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, no.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: No pins and needles.  Any muscle weaknesses at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um just, I, I suppose general aching, body aching.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Not, not any weakness but where you couldn't, you know, hold a cup or anything like that, that's what I mean.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, no. I'm, I'm sort of, yeah, <UNIN/> seem to be sort of fine with that sort of stuff but, yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Ohh <UNIN/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Okay, and um just a few more questions to you, because I don't have any of your background history. Um, do you suffer from any medical conditions?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh no, um general medical history is fine.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Fine. And no surgical history <UNSURE> then </UNSURE> and no medical surgical complaints, yeah?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, no. Um, I, I suppose uh I have been away to um, uh, Thailand.  Um, uh <UNIN/> week or so ago. Um

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: had some, like, <UNIN/> usual mosquito bites from sort of traveling around and <UNIN/> a friend of mine has also been a bit unwell, but um, uh, yeah, that 's the only sort of, like, history per se.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right, and um, do you have any kind of shivering at all?  Do you shivering with the fever?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, I um, uh, I I do feel cold quite a lot. Uh, you know it's, um, I no sort of shivering, but definitely like a bit cold.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> cold, yeah?  OK, right.  And are you using <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>  you mentioned about the paracetamol and <UNIN/>  now, but are you on any <UNIN/> regular, any medication, anything that you're using at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yep.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, no.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK.  Um, any <UNSURE>allergies</UNSURE> at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, no. Um

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Alright.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK and... OK, so uh I, I believe that it is quite important for us to actually examine you, yeah?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, it it's not <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>  possible for us to do that online. I think you would need to come into one of our hubs to have a proper examination, and I, I think you would need one quite urgently, OK? So the thing that's <UNIN/> running in the back of my mind are um, kind of a viral illnesses that can one can get with um, sort of mosquito bites or foreign travel.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Like <UNIN/>, um <UNIN/> the other common thing around Thailand, it will be like some dengue.  But that would have, like you would have some, uh, blood spots or bleeding or something, which you don't have at the moment, do you?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh <UNIN/> no. I mean I've got a bit of a rash, but nothing like, uh no, no, no, no bleeding.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. So where is the rash?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, it's uh, the rash is kind of <UNIN/> all over my body. Like it's not, it's not, it's not really localised.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: How would <UNSURE>you describe</UNSURE>, how would you describe the rash?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um uh sort of red and itchy.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Red and itchy. OK. So if you were to put a glass on top of the rash, does that rash go away?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, yes.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: It goes away. OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. So <UNIN/> what we need to do, <UNIN/> need to urgently examine you. And that's sometime today. OK? And um, after our examination there is a high possibility that sometimes we might need to send you to hospital. But I'm not sure as yet. So I'd like you to be seen in one of our hubs as soon as possible?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNIN/> OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: So um, I'll <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> recommend that you would need to be urgently seen by the doctor, preferably in the next few hours time. OK? And um, in any case if that's not available I'd like you to take yourself to <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>. Alright? Any questions at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, no. <UNSURE>Sounds </UNSURE> serious.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/>, you know obviously when I've spoken to you, you, you didn't tick the box for many theories, but you're in the middle somewhere. Let's put it that way.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um <UNIN/> you know things like we have to rule out is Meningitis and all, but Ben, you just have a general muscle ache. You didn't say that you had things like, you had problems looking at the light or something <UNIN/> Those are things when you think of Meningitis

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: But and then, it's the uh, in meningitis you get a non-blanching <UNIN/> rash. While in any kind of virus <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> the rash usually goes away. Saying that, we don't know whether these are the beginning stage. So that's why I'd rather, but I would rather you see a <UNIN/> GP as soon as possible, if uh, we've got a slot available. But if not, I think you need to be seen, and maybe have some blood tests and examinations. OK?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK, cool. Thank you very much.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: All right, you take care, Ben. Bye now. Cheers. Bye.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> Bye.
